instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Hey another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> external image ok but panel no image. where to start, tested 4 different displays. 2 cracked working and 2 unknown

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: History fault, liquid sign at video connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: no liquid, customer changed display and something happen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
He probably forgot to disconnect the battery.
Check diode mode to ground at EDP_INT_ lines of J8500.
Compare with good board, if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Do you get same 0.239 reading on ALL 10 (ten) EDP_INT_ lines for sure???
